boat.name: Spray
boat.short_description: Built by the famous Lancashire Nobby builder, Crossfields of Arnside in 1896 and is one of the last remaining boats from that era that is not only afloat but regularly partakes in boating events all around the Irish Sea.  As well as a regular competitor in the Liverpool and Conway Nobby races. Her sailing adventures include North Wales, Ireland, Scotland, the Cumbrian Coast and not forgetting her years present at the Peel Traditional Boat Festival at Peel on the Isle of Man.

for_sales.sales_text: A 125-Year-Old Classic  Spray is a Classic Morecambe Bay Prawner with an exceptional pedigree.  Regrettably due to bereavement she is looking for a new and caring custodian. No compromises have been made in her restoration and her continued professional maintenance and maritime upgrades are to the highest level of any Morecambe Bay Prawner.  Widely cruised and raced, she has lots of trophies to her credit.  Built in 1896 by Crossfield's of Arnside, she is 32’ 3” x 9'6” X 4', registered as 7.36 tons. She has accommodation for four persons, two single bunks and one large (bow) double / two singles. This turnkey boat comes with a large suite of sails, a self-folding propeller, Garmin GPS, Maritime DSC Radio and a 4 person life-raft.    Her rigging comprises two Wykeham-Martin Furling Gears along with sheets set up for one person management of the mainsail. She can reach 9 knots under sail.  She runs at a reliable 7 knots under the power of a reliable 40 hp inboard diesel engine fitted to a hydraulic gearbox with a 40 gallon fuel tank.  She has a two-burner stove below.
